title: Audit service isn't working for existing tenants
content:
You see that Audit service is working for new tenants but not for existing tenants.

Cause

This issue occurs if Audit service isn't enabled for existing tenants. 

Solution

You can enable the Audit menu for existing tenants by running the EnableAuditMegaMenu.bin, which is part of the Audit Helm package.

To enable the Audit menu for all the active tenants, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the audit install directory audit-<version> that you created when downloading the Audit Helm chart. For example:

    cd <audit_install-dir>/audit-20xx.xx

  2. Run the following command to enable Audit:

    ./EnableAuditMegaMenu.bin -f <Hostname> -p <Port> -a <Audit Service URL>

    For example:

    ./EnableAuditMegaMenu.bin -f smax.example.com -p 443 -a https://audit.example.com:443
  3. When prompted for a password, give the password of the seeded integration user.

To enable the Audit menu for a specific active tenant, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the audit install directory audit-<version> that you created when downloading the Audit Helm chart. For example:

    cd <audit_install-dir>/audit-20xx.xx

  2. Run the following command to enable Audit:

    ./EnableAuditMegaMenu.bin -f <Hostname> -p <Port> -a <Audit Service URL> -t <Tenant ID>

    For example:

    ./EnableAuditMegaMenu.sh -f smax.example.com -p 443 -a https://audit.example.com:443 -t 123456

  3. When prompted for a password, give the password of the seeded integration user.
